heaviest_rainfall.status: The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 09 November 2025, with precipitation totalling 47.89mm.  The rain fell at 24.6mm per hour at times over the course of the 144.8 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 34.3mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 09 November 2025, it lasted 144.8 hours and it delivered 47.89mm of rain at a maximum rate of 24.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning strikes in one day since 11 April 2025 is 23 and it happened on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: There is a storm in the vicinity.  This is the first storm since 06 February 2026.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 13 January 2026 and lasted for 22 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 3 cold snaps, usually there are 3.6 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwaves.status: There is not an active heatwaves.  There has been 0 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical.status: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is south-westerly (216°).  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: To date, the maximum wind gust recorded is 128.2 mph on 27 January 2026.

run.status: 1737 miles is the largest wind run recorded on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.7 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in rainfall (up 0.7 mm) and pressure (down 7 mbar).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (up 0.3 mm) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 85.6m higher than yesterday, 3.1m lower than the past week, 16.1m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 557m minimum and 849m maximum, with an average of 757.2m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 760.3m and 773.3m.
cloud levels.summary: Low clouds are expected, possibly some fog or persistent clouds.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; chilly temperatures are forecasted. Also, the air will feel dry and very little to no wind will be present. Drizzle or light rain possible, low clouds are expected, possibly some fog or persistent clouds, and some sunny spells will occur. Low pressure may lead to stormy or rainy weather.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (92%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
